events.title: Battle of the Ebro begins
events.description: The Battle of the Ebro, one of the longest and largest battles of the Spanish Civil War, commenced as Republican forces launched an offensive against Franco's Nationalist troops.
events.significance: It marked a crucial turning point in the Spanish Civil War, exhausting Republican resources and leading to Nationalist victory.

events.title: Spanish Civil War ends
events.description: Although the Battle of the Ebro began in late July 1938, on March 28, 1939, Madrid fell to the Nationalist forces, essentially ending the Spanish Civil War.
events.significance: The victory solidified Francisco Franco's dictatorship in Spain for several decades.

events.title: SS St. Louis incident begins
events.description: The ocean liner SS St. Louis, carrying Jewish refugees fleeing Nazi Germany, was denied entry to Cuba and later the United States, forcing passengers to return to Europe.
events.significance: This event highlighted the global refusal to accept Jewish refugees, with tragic consequences for many.

events.title: The last known Tasmanian tiger dies
events.description: The last known thylacine, commonly known as the Tasmanian tiger, died in captivity at the Hobart Zoo in Tasmania, Australia.
events.significance: This marked the extinction of a unique marsupial species, symbolizing human impact on biodiversity.

events.title: The German occupation of Czechoslovakia
events.description: Germany formally annexed the remaining Czech lands, establishing the Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia following the Munich Agreement.
events.significance: This act demonstrated Nazi Germany's aggressive expansionist policy leading up to World War II.
